question: Which of the following explains why companies would use a third-party logistics (3PL) provider to distribute products?

answers.text: 3PL providers have the expertise, flexibility, and cost efficiencies that manufacturers do not possess in logistics.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. While some 3PL providers own and operate their own transportation system, it wouldn’t be the only reason that a company would work with them.

answers.text: 3PL providers understand how to promote a product more effectively than a company does.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. While some 3PL providers offering warehousing and inventory management services, it wouldn’t be the only reason that a company would work with them.

answers.text: 3PL providers own warehouses to help store and manage inventory.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. There is no evidence that 3PL providers know how to promote products more effectively than manufacturers.

answers.text: 3 PL providers own and operate their own transportation system.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: 3PL providers have the expertise, flexibility, and cost efficiencies in logistics that manufacturers don’t possess.

detailedSolution: 3PL providers have the expertise, flexibility, and cost efficiencies in logistics that manufacturers donâ€™t possess.
